title: Emman Abeleda
text:
Emman Abeleda is a <a href="Filipino%20people">Filipino</a> actor, singer and dancer.
Career.
Abeleda practically grew up on screen, he first started appearing on films as early as 1996. As a child actor, he often portrayed son and younger brother roles.
On television, he first appeared as Jun-Jun Estrera in the soap opera "<a href="Esperanza%20%28Philippine%20TV%20series%29">Esperanza</a>" all the while appearing in the sitcom "<a href="Kaya%20ni%20Mister%2C%20Kaya%20ni%20Misis">Kaya ni Mister, Kaya ni Misis</a>"—both shows started running from 1997 and ending respectively in 1999 and 2001.
From 1997 to 1999, Abeleda appeared in "<a href="Flames%20%28TV%20series%29%23Film%20adaptaion">Flames: The Movie</a> (Pangako)", "Haba Baba Doo, Puti Puti Poo" and the Christmas film "<a href="Puso%20ng%20Pasko">Puso ng Pasko</a>". First earning his <a href="FAMAS%20Awards">FAMAS Awards</a> nomination in 1998 for "Minsan Lamang Magmamahal".
In 2003, he would reprise his role as Jun-Jun, the son of <a href="Maricel%20Soriano">Maricel Soriano</a> and <a href="Cesar%20Montano">Cesar Montano</a>'s characters in "Kaya ni Mister, Kaya ni Misis", in the sequel series "<a href="Bida%20si%20Mister%2C%20Bida%20si%20Misis">Bida si Mister, Bida si Misis</a>". In the same year, Abeleda started performing with <a href="Sergio%20Garcia%20%28actor%29">Sergio Garcia</a>, <a href="Mhyco%20Aquino">Mhyco Aquino</a>, <a href="Rayver%20Cruz">Rayver Cruz</a>, <a href="John%20Wayne%20Sace">John Wayne Sace</a> and <a href="Mico%20Aytona">Mico Aytona</a>. as a group. The group composed mostly of former child actors, would eventually be introduced as singing and dancing teen idol Anim-E the following year and were mainstays in the weekly variety show "<a href="ASAP%20%28Philippine%20TV%20program%29">ASAP</a>".
